name: civicinfo
title: Google Civic Information API
description: Provides polling places, early vote locations, contest data, election officials, and government representatives for U.S. residential addresses.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

schemas.name: VoterInfoRequest
schemas.desc: A request for information about a voter.

schemas.name: PollingLocation
schemas.desc: A location where a voter can vote. This may be an early vote site, an election day voting location, or a drop off location for a completed ballot.

fields.name: startDate
fields.desc: The first date that this early vote site or drop off location may be used. This field is not populated for polling locations.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the early vote site or drop off location. This field is not populated for polling locations.

fields.name: endDate
fields.desc: The last date that this early vote site or drop off location may be used. This field is not populated for polling locations.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An ID for this object. IDs may change in future requests and should not be cached. Access to this field requires special access that can be requested from the Request more link on the Quotas page.

fields.name: notes
fields.desc: Notes about this location (e.g. accessibility ramp or entrance to use).

fields.name: pollingHours
fields.desc: A description of when this location is open.

fields.name: sources
fields.desc: A list of sources for this location. If multiple sources are listed the data has been aggregated from those sources.

fields.name: voterServices
fields.desc: The services provided by this early vote site or drop off location. This field is not populated for polling locations.

fields.name: address
fields.desc: The address of the location.

schemas.name: DivisionSearchResponse
schemas.desc: The result of a division search query.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "civicinfo#divisionSearchResponse".

schemas.name: ElectionOfficial
schemas.desc: Information about individual election officials.

fields.name: emailAddress
fields.desc: The email address of the election official.

fields.name: faxNumber
fields.desc: The fax number of the election official.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The full name of the election official.

fields.name: officePhoneNumber
fields.desc: The office phone number of the election official.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: The title of the election official.

fields.name: divisions
fields.desc: Political geographic divisions that contain the requested address.

fields.name: offices
fields.desc: Elected offices referenced by the divisions listed above. Will only be present if includeOffices was true in the request.

fields.name: officials
fields.desc: Officials holding the offices listed above. Will only be present if includeOffices was true in the request.

schemas.name: SimpleAddressType
schemas.desc: A simple representation of an address.

fields.name: zip
fields.desc: The US Postal Zip Code of the address.

fields.name: city
fields.desc: The city or town for the address.

fields.name: line1
fields.desc: The street name and number of this address.

fields.name: line2
fields.desc: The second line the address, if needed.

fields.name: line3
fields.desc: The third line of the address, if needed.

fields.name: locationName
fields.desc: The name of the location.

fields.name: state
fields.desc: The US two letter state abbreviation of the address.

schemas.name: DivisionRepresentativeInfoRequest
schemas.desc: A request to look up representative information for a single division.

schemas.name: DivisionSearchResult
schemas.desc: Represents a political geographic division that matches the requested query.

fields.name: aliases
fields.desc: Other Open Civic Data identifiers that refer to the same division -- for example, those that refer to other political divisions whose boundaries are defined to be coterminous with this one. For example, ocd-division/country:us/state:wy will include an alias of ocd-division/country:us/state:wy/cd:1, since Wyoming has only one Congressional district.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the division.

fields.name: ocdId
fields.desc: The unique Open Civic Data identifier for this division.

schemas.name: Candidate
schemas.desc: Information about a candidate running for elected office.

fields.name: photoUrl
fields.desc: A URL for a photo of the candidate.

fields.name: candidateUrl
fields.desc: The URL for the candidate's campaign web site.

fields.name: channels
fields.desc: A list of known (social) media channels for this candidate.

fields.name: email
fields.desc: The email address for the candidate's campaign.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The candidate's name. If this is a joint ticket it will indicate the name of the candidate at the top of a ticket followed by a / and that name of candidate at the bottom of the ticket. e.g. "Mitt Romney / Paul Ryan"

fields.name: orderOnBallot
fields.desc: The order the candidate appears on the ballot for this contest.

fields.name: party
fields.desc: The full name of the party the candidate is a member of.

fields.name: phone
fields.desc: The voice phone number for the candidate's campaign office.

schemas.name: ElectionsQueryResponse
schemas.desc: The list of elections available for this version of the API.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "civicinfo#electionsQueryResponse".

fields.name: elections
fields.desc: A list of available elections

schemas.name: ElectoralDistrict
schemas.desc: Describes the geographic scope of a contest.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the district.

fields.name: scope
fields.desc: The geographic scope of this district. If unspecified the district's geography is not known. One of: national, statewide, congressional, stateUpper, stateLower, countywide, judicial, schoolBoard, cityWide, township, countyCouncil, cityCouncil, ward, special

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An identifier for this district, relative to its scope. For example, the 34th State Senate district would have id "34" and a scope of stateUpper.

schemas.name: GeographicDivision
schemas.desc: Describes a political geography.

fields.name: alsoKnownAs
fields.desc:
Any other valid OCD IDs that refer to the same division.

Because OCD IDs are meant to be human-readable and at least somewhat predictable, there are occasionally several identifiers for a single division. These identifiers are defined to be equivalent to one another, and one is always indicated as the primary identifier. The primary identifier will be returned in ocd_id above, and any other equivalent valid identifiers will be returned in this list.

For example, if this division's OCD ID is ocd-division/country:us/district:dc, this will contain ocd-division/country:us/state:dc.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the division.

fields.name: officeIndices
fields.desc: List of indices in the offices array, one for each office elected from this division. Will only be present if includeOffices was true (or absent) in the request.

schemas.name: RepresentativeInfoRequest
schemas.desc: A request for political geography and representative information for an address.

schemas.name: RepresentativeInfoResponse
schemas.desc: The result of a representative info lookup query.

fields.name: divisions
fields.desc: Political geographic divisions that contain the requested address.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "civicinfo#representativeInfoResponse".

fields.name: normalizedInput
fields.desc: The normalized version of the requested address

fields.name: offices
fields.desc: Elected offices referenced by the divisions listed above. Will only be present if includeOffices was true in the request.

fields.name: officials
fields.desc: Officials holding the offices listed above. Will only be present if includeOffices was true in the request.

schemas.name: Office
schemas.desc: Information about an Office held by one or more Officials.

fields.name: roles
fields.desc: The roles which this office fulfills. Roles are not meant to be exhaustive, or to exactly specify the entire set of responsibilities of a given office, but are meant to be rough categories that are useful for general selection from or sorting of a list of offices.

fields.name: sources
fields.desc: A list of sources for this office. If multiple sources are listed, the data has been aggregated from those sources.

fields.name: divisionId
fields.desc: The OCD ID of the division with which this office is associated.

fields.name: levels
fields.desc: The levels of government of which this office is part. There may be more than one in cases where a jurisdiction effectively acts at two different levels of government; for example, the mayor of the District of Columbia acts at "locality" level, but also effectively at both "administrative-area-2" and "administrative-area-1".

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The human-readable name of the office.

fields.name: officialIndices
fields.desc: List of indices in the officials array of people who presently hold this office.

schemas.name: Channel
schemas.desc: A social media or web channel for a candidate.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique public identifier for the candidate's channel.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of channel. The following is a list of types of channels, but is not exhaustive. More channel types may be added at a later time. One of: GooglePlus, YouTube, Facebook, Twitter

schemas.name: Election
schemas.desc: Information about the election that was queried.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique ID of this election.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: A displayable name for the election.

fields.name: ocdDivisionId
fields.desc: The political division of the election. Represented as an OCD Division ID. Voters within these political jurisdictions are covered by this election. This is typically a state such as ocd-division/country:us/state:ca or for the midterms or general election the entire US (i.e. ocd-division/country:us).

fields.name: electionDay
fields.desc: Day of the election in YYYY-MM-DD format.

schemas.name: VoterInfoResponse
schemas.desc: The result of a voter info lookup query.

fields.name: mailOnly
fields.desc: Specifies whether voters in the precinct vote only by mailing their ballots (with the possible option of dropping off their ballots as well).

fields.name: normalizedInput
fields.desc: The normalized version of the requested address

fields.name: otherElections
fields.desc: If no election ID was specified in the query, and there was more than one election with data for the given voter, this will contain information about the other elections that could apply.

fields.name: state
fields.desc: Local Election Information for the state that the voter votes in. For the US, there will only be one element in this array.

fields.name: earlyVoteSites
fields.desc: Locations where the voter is eligible to vote early, prior to election day.

fields.name: dropOffLocations
fields.desc: Locations where a voter is eligible to drop off a completed ballot. The voter must have received and completed a ballot prior to arriving at the location. The location may not have ballots available on the premises. These locations could be open on or before election day as indicated in the pollingHours field.

fields.name: election
fields.desc: The election that was queried.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "civicinfo#voterInfoResponse".

fields.name: pollingLocations
fields.desc: Locations where the voter is eligible to vote on election day.

fields.name: contests
fields.desc: Contests that will appear on the voter's ballot.

schemas.name: DivisionSearchRequest
schemas.desc: A search request for political geographies.

schemas.name: Official
schemas.desc: Information about a person holding an elected office.

fields.name: address
fields.desc: Addresses at which to contact the official.

fields.name: channels
fields.desc: A list of known (social) media channels for this official.

fields.name: emails
fields.desc: The direct email addresses for the official.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The official's name.

fields.name: party
fields.desc: The full name of the party the official belongs to.

fields.name: phones
fields.desc: The official's public contact phone numbers.

fields.name: photoUrl
fields.desc: A URL for a photo of the official.

fields.name: urls
fields.desc: The official's public website URLs.

schemas.name: Contest
schemas.desc: Information about a contest that appears on a voter's ballot.

fields.name: referendumUrl
fields.desc: A link to the referendum. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: sources
fields.desc: A list of sources for this contest. If multiple sources are listed, the data has been aggregated from those sources.

fields.name: district
fields.desc: Information about the electoral district that this contest is in.

fields.name: referendumBallotResponses
fields.desc: The set of ballot responses for the referendum. A ballot response represents a line on the ballot. Common examples might include "yes" or "no" for referenda. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumPassageThreshold
fields.desc: The threshold of votes that the referendum needs in order to pass, e.g. "two-thirds". This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumText
fields.desc: The full text of the referendum. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: roles
fields.desc: The roles which this office fulfills.

fields.name: ballotPlacement
fields.desc: A number specifying the position of this contest on the voter's ballot.

fields.name: level
fields.desc: The levels of government of the office for this contest. There may be more than one in cases where a jurisdiction effectively acts at two different levels of government; for example, the mayor of the District of Columbia acts at "locality" level, but also effectively at both "administrative-area-2" and "administrative-area-1".

fields.name: primaryParty
fields.desc: If this is a partisan election, the name of the party it is for.

fields.name: referendumProStatement
fields.desc: A statement in favor of the referendum. It does not necessarily appear on the ballot. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumBrief
fields.desc: Specifies a short summary of the referendum that is typically on the ballot below the title but above the text. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumSubtitle
fields.desc: A brief description of the referendum. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumTitle
fields.desc: The title of the referendum (e.g. 'Proposition 42'). This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: special
fields.desc: "Yes" or "No" depending on whether this a contest being held outside the normal election cycle.

fields.name: candidates
fields.desc: The candidate choices for this contest.

fields.name: electorateSpecifications
fields.desc: A description of any additional eligibility requirements for voting in this contest.

fields.name: numberElected
fields.desc: The number of candidates that will be elected to office in this contest.

fields.name: numberVotingFor
fields.desc: The number of candidates that a voter may vote for in this contest.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of contest. Usually this will be 'General', 'Primary', or 'Run-off' for contests with candidates. For referenda this will be 'Referendum'. For Retention contests this will typically be 'Retention'.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An ID for this object. IDs may change in future requests and should not be cached. Access to this field requires special access that can be requested from the Request more link on the Quotas page.

fields.name: office
fields.desc: The name of the office for this contest.

fields.name: referendumConStatement
fields.desc: A statement in opposition to the referendum. It does not necessarily appear on the ballot. This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

fields.name: referendumEffectOfAbstain
fields.desc: Specifies what effect abstaining (not voting) on the proposition will have (i.e. whether abstaining is considered a vote against it). This field is only populated for contests of type 'Referendum'.

schemas.name: AdministrationRegion
schemas.desc: Describes information about a regional election administrative area.

fields.name: electionAdministrationBody
fields.desc: The election administration body for this area.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An ID for this object. IDs may change in future requests and should not be cached. Access to this field requires special access that can be requested from the Request more link on the Quotas page.

fields.name: local_jurisdiction
fields.desc: The city or county that provides election information for this voter. This object can have the same elements as state.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the jurisdiction.

fields.name: sources
fields.desc: A list of sources for this area. If multiple sources are listed the data has been aggregated from those sources.

schemas.name: AdministrativeBody
schemas.desc: Information about an election administrative body (e.g. County Board of Elections).

fields.name: ballotInfoUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body to give contest information to the voter.

fields.name: correspondenceAddress
fields.desc: The mailing address of this administrative body.

fields.name: electionOfficials
fields.desc: The election officials for this election administrative body.

fields.name: absenteeVotingInfoUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body for information on absentee voting.

fields.name: electionRegistrationUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body for looking up how to register to vote.

fields.name: electionRulesUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body describing election rules to the voter.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of this election administrative body.

fields.name: physicalAddress
fields.desc: The physical address of this administrative body.

fields.name: voter_services
fields.desc: A description of the services this administrative body may provide.

fields.name: electionInfoUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body for looking up general election information.

fields.name: hoursOfOperation
fields.desc: A description of the hours of operation for this administrative body.

fields.name: electionRegistrationConfirmationUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body for confirming that the voter is registered to vote.

fields.name: votingLocationFinderUrl
fields.desc: A URL provided by this administrative body for looking up where to vote.

schemas.name: Source
schemas.desc: Contains information about the data source for the element containing it.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the data source.

fields.name: official
fields.desc: Whether this data comes from an official government source.

methods.name: search
methods.desc: Searches for political divisions by their natural name or OCD ID.

optinalQueryParams.name: query
optinalQueryParams.desc: The search query. Queries can cover any parts of a OCD ID or a human readable division name. All words given in the query are treated as required patterns. In addition to that, most query operators of the Apache Lucene library are supported. See http://lucene.apache.org/core/2_9_4/queryparsersyntax.html

methods.name: voterInfoQuery
methods.desc: Looks up information relevant to a voter based on the voter's registered address.

requiredQueryParams.name: address
requiredQueryParams.desc: The registered address of the voter to look up.

optinalQueryParams.name: officialOnly
optinalQueryParams.desc: If set to true, only data from official state sources will be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: returnAllAvailableData
optinalQueryParams.desc: If set to true, the query will return the success codeand include any partial information when it is unable to determine a matching address or unable to determine the election for electionId=0 queries.

optinalQueryParams.name: electionId
optinalQueryParams.desc: The unique ID of the election to look up. A list of election IDs can be obtained at https://www.googleapis.com/civicinfo/{version}/elections

methods.name: electionQuery
methods.desc: List of available elections to query.

methods.name: representativeInfoByAddress
methods.desc: Looks up political geography and representative information for a single address.

optinalQueryParams.name: includeOffices
optinalQueryParams.desc: Whether to return information about offices and officials. If false, only the top-level district information will be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: levels
optinalQueryParams.desc: A list of office levels to filter by. Only offices that serve at least one of these levels will be returned. Divisions that don't contain a matching office will not be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: roles
optinalQueryParams.desc: A list of office roles to filter by. Only offices fulfilling one of these roles will be returned. Divisions that don't contain a matching office will not be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: address
optinalQueryParams.desc: The address to look up. May only be specified if the field ocdId is not given in the URL.

methods.name: representativeInfoByDivision
methods.desc: Looks up representative information for a single geographic division.

pathParams.name: ocdId
pathParams.desc: The Open Civic Data division identifier of the division to look up.

optinalQueryParams.name: recursive
optinalQueryParams.desc: If true, information about all divisions contained in the division requested will be included as well. For example, if querying ocd-division/country:us/district:dc, this would also return all DC's wards and ANCs.

optinalQueryParams.name: roles
optinalQueryParams.desc: A list of office roles to filter by. Only offices fulfilling one of these roles will be returned. Divisions that don't contain a matching office will not be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: levels
optinalQueryParams.desc: A list of office levels to filter by. Only offices that serve at least one of these levels will be returned. Divisions that don't contain a matching office will not be returned.
